# Connecting with Opal data server
## Login to server and assign study data
```{r, echo=FALSE}
#Load R libraries
library(opal)
library(tidyverse)
library(epiDisplay)
# Create an opal object with the login information
erasmus_opal <- opal.login()
#Login to Opal server and assign the content of the LUCAS table(s) to your RStudio environment
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'LASA2B', 'LASA.LASA2B', variables=list('bhbd1','bhart05','bhart06','bcva04','bcva03','bdiabe01','bdiabe02','bdiabe03','bdiabe04','bdiabe04','bmweight','bmwaist','bsubhea1','bmed_hyp','bmvar156','bhart10','bcva02','diabe02','bcva01','bmed153','bmed155','bmed150','bmed152','bage','badl1a','badl5a','bmed156','bmed157','byear','bhart01'))
LASA2B <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'LASA2B')

opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'LASA2F', 'LASA.LASA2F', variables=list('fhbd1','fhbd2a','fcva02a','fcva02b','fhart05','fhart06','fcva04','fcva03','fdiabe01','fdiabe02','fdiabe03','fdiabe04','fdiabe04','fmed153','fmed155','fmweight','fmwaist','fsubhea1','fmed152','fmed150','fcva01','fage','fadl1a','fadl5a','fmed156','fmed157','byear','fhart01'))
LASA2F <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'LASA2F')

opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'LASA2G', 'LASA.LASA2G', variables=list('ghbd1','ghbd2a','ghart05','ghart06','gcva04','gcva03','gcva02a','gcva02b','gdiabe01','gdiabe02','gdiabe03','gdiabe04','gdiabe04','gmweight','gmed155','gmed153','gmed152','gmed150','gmwaist','gsubhea1','gmed155','gmed152','gcva01','gage','gadl1a','gadl5a','gmed156','gmed157','byear','ghart01'))
LASA2G <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'LASA2G')

opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'LASA2H', 'LASA.LASA2H', variables=list('HHBD1','HHBD2A','HHART06','HHART05','HCVA02A','HCVA02B','HDIABE01','HDIABE02','HDIABE03','HDIABE04','HMED155','HMED153','HMED150','HMED152','HMED152','hsubhea1','HDIABE01','hage','HADL1A','HADL5A','HMED156','HMED157','byear','HHART01'))
LASA2H <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'LASA2H')
```
## Assign participant id as first column of your harmonized dataframes
```{r, echo=FALSE}
oth_LASA2_0 <- data.frame(id = LASA2B$id)
oth_LASA2_1 <- data.frame(id = LASA2F$id)
oth_LASA2_2 <- data.frame(id = LASA2G$id)
oth_LASA2_3 <- data.frame(id = LASA2H$id)
```
## When you are done with your work, logout of Opal server
```{r, echo=FALSE}
opal.logout(erasmus_opal) 
```

# Hypertension subdomain

### **Variable label**: Lifetime occurrence of high blood pressure or hypertension    
**Variable name**: dis_hbp_ever_0  
**Variable description**:  Occurrence of high blood pressure or hypertension at any point during the life of the participant.   
**Value type**:  integer  
**Variable unit**:  N/A  
**Category coding:**  
  
**Code**   | **Category Label**    
-----------| -------------  
0          |  Never had high blood pressure or hypertension  
1          |  Ever had high blood pressure or hypertension  

**Harmonization status**:  complete    
**Harmonization comment**:  Currently has hypertension is used. In general once a respondent has hypertension, they are affected by this chronic disease for life.   
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
oth_LASA2_0$dis_hbp_ever_0 <- recode(as.integer(LASA2B$bhbd1),'1'=0L,'2'=1L,.default=NA_integer_)
```

# Myocardial infarction subdomain

### **Variable label**: Lifetime occurrence of myocardial infarction    
**Variable name**:  dis_mi_ever_0  
**Variable description**:  Occurrence of myocardial infarction (heart attack) at any point during the life of the participant.    
**Value type**:  integer  
**Variable unit**:  N/A  
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
---------| -------------  
0        |   Never had myocardial infarction
1        |   Ever had myocardial infarction  

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**:  bhart01 question  
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
#Merging the raw tables LASA2B-LASA2H
MyMerge2 <- function(x,y){
  merge(x,y, by=c("id","byear"),all=TRUE)
}
med_table2 <- Reduce(MyMerge2, list(LASA2B,LASA2F,LASA2G,LASA2H))
#Harmonization scripts to create "ever had mi"
med_table2$dis_mi_ever_0 <- ifelse(as.integer(med_table2$bhart05)==1 | (as.integer(med_table2$bhart05)==-2 & as.integer(med_table2$bhart01)== 1),0L, ifelse(as.integer(med_table2$bhart05)==2,1L,NA))
#Direct mapping to harmonized tables keeping correct participants for each wave
oth_LASA2_0<-merge(oth_LASA2_0,med_table2[,c("id","dis_mi_ever_0")],by="id",all.x=TRUE)
```  
### **Variable label**: Lifetime occurrence of myocardial infarction    
**Variable name**:  dis_mi_ever_1  
**Variable description**:  Occurrence of myocardial infarction (heart attack) at any point during the life of the participant.    
**Value type**:  integer  
**Variable unit**:  N/A  
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
---------| -------------  
0        |   Never had myocardial infarction
1        |   Ever had myocardial infarction  

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**: 	fhart01 & fhart05 & dis_mi_ever_0 question  
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
#Harmonization scripts to create "ever had mi"
med_table2$dis_mi_ever_1  <- ifelse(med_table2$dis_mi_ever_0==1 | (med_table2$dis_mi_ever_0==0 & as.integer(med_table2$fhart05)==2),1L, ifelse(as.integer(med_table2$fhart01)==0 | (med_table2$dis_mi_ever_0==0 & (as.integer(med_table2$fhart01)== 2 | as.integer(med_table2$fhart01)== 3) & as.integer(med_table2$fhart05)==1),0L,NA))
#Direct mapping to harmonized tables keeping correct participants for each wave
oth_LASA2_1<-merge(oth_LASA2_1,med_table[,c("id","dis_mi_ever_1")],by="id",all.x=TRUE)
```  
### **Variable label**: Lifetime occurrence of myocardial infarction    
**Variable name**:  dis_mi_ever_2  
**Variable description**:  Occurrence of myocardial infarction (heart attack) at any point during the life of the participant.    
**Value type**:  integer  
**Variable unit**:  N/A  
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
---------| -------------

**Harmonization comment**: 	dhart01 & dhart05 & dis_mi_ever_1 question  
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}

med_table2$dis_mi_ever_2  <- ifelse(med_table2$dis_mi_ever_1==1 | (med_table2$dis_mi_ever_1==0 & as.integer(med_table2$ghart05)==2),1L, ifelse(as.integer(med_table2$ghart01)==0 | (med_table2$dis_mi_ever_1==0 & (as.integer(med_table2$ghart01)== 2 | as.integer(med_table2$ghart01)== 3) & as.integer(med_table2$ghart05)==1),0L,NA))
#Direct mapping to harmonized tables keeping correct participants for each wave
oth_LASA2_2<-merge(oth_LASA2_2,med_table[,c("id","dis_mi_ever_2")],by="id",all.x=TRUE)
```
